pros: Good environment great people love the food
cons: Bad pay Long hours mean

pros: The opportunity to work for an agency that is making an impact in the community is a great reason to work there.
cons: People are overworked, underpaid and under appreciated. Management is not good at fixing staff morale, instead they give more work and more expectations to staff members with no compensation. I paid for a course that was professional development and was only allowed a few paid days off work to take the week long course. They do not support their staff to grow in their respective professions. There is no room to move up in the agency. I have been there for three years in the same position and there is no management position for me to move up to. I would need to stay for 15 plus years in order to move up to the next position level.

pros: It was such a great experience working with a child to help them find their confidence. We read books, played sports and had a lot of fun.
cons: Very few complaints about my experience. If I had to pick I would say that there could have been a little more structure to the experience. A lot of times I found myself not really knowing what to do with the child or what to teach them. More helping this area would have been appreciated.

pros: Great job satisfaction, very flexible schedule, tight-knit team, working with kids and adults, not too structured, good balance of office and fieldwork
cons: Low pay because it's a non-profit, management could be better, no HR department, tiny team, always scrambling for funds, overworked, not much room to grow in your career. More of a stepping stone to a better job.

pros:
- Diligent pairing process to find the best 'fit' between 'mentor' and students
- Perfect 'fit': Children were eager to learn/not afraid to ask questions about homework
- Rewarding experience
- Upper management easy to contact, speak to
cons: - None!  The school I was stationed to tutor at was slightly far from my school, only because management could not find any availabilities in primary schools that were closer.  They truly tried to find the most convenient location though.

pros: Awesome people that are really passionate and genuinely care about what they're doing. It was a very positive groupon individuals who are dedicated to helping the community.
cons: Very low pay for the amount of knowledge and work that was expected. Non profit organizations do not get enough government funding to pay their people what they deserve.

pros: Most of the employees were great people, hard working, dedicated to serving the mission, with good ethics.
cons: The board micro-manages, hires low calibre executive directors with poor management skills and ill-suited values for the charity's mission, leading to the board's mistrust of the executive director, often with good reason.  Due to the mistrust between staff and management/executive, some of the staff formed little exclusive cliques, whispering behind closed doors, and wasting time complaining about the board and mismanagement of the organization.

pros: Very friendly co workers.  Nice to be working for a worthwhile cause.
cons: I had to leave as I found a full-time position elsewhere.  Pay was what you would expect.  Nothing negative to say.

review_title: Good organization. Too much internal drama.
pros: Rewarding work, 35-hr week, good branding, good location, parking on site, had a good manager (has left now), great place to make friends
cons: Low pay, coworkers can be mean, horrible benefits/vacation, management lacks diversity
